description: Retrieves information about a specific machine learning model version.

parameters.name: ModelName
parameters.description: The name of the machine learning model that this version belongs to.

parameters.name: ModelVersion
parameters.description: The version of the machine learning model.

nested_items.name: ModelName
nested_items.description: The name of the machine learning model that this version belongs to.

nested_items.name: ModelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the parent machine learning model that this version belong to.

nested_items.name: ModelVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the machine learning model.

nested_items.name: ModelVersionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model version.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the model version.

nested_items.name: SourceType
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this model version was created by training or by importing.

nested_items.name: DatasetName
nested_items.description: The name of the dataset used to train the model version.

nested_items.name: DatasetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset used to train the model version.

nested_items.name: Schema
nested_items.description: The schema of the data used to train the model version.

nested_items.name: LabelsInputConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration information for the S3 location being used to hold label data.

nested_items.name: S3InputConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains location information for the S3 location being used for label data.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket holding the label data.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: The prefix for the S3 bucket used for the label data.

nested_items.name: LabelGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the label group to be used for label data.

nested_items.name: TrainingDataStartTime
nested_items.description: The date on which the training data began being gathered. If you imported the version, this is the date that the training data in the source version began being gathered.

nested_items.name: TrainingDataEndTime
nested_items.description: The date on which the training data finished being gathered. If you imported the version, this is the date that the training data in the source version finished being gathered.

nested_items.name: EvaluationDataStartTime
nested_items.description: The date on which the data in the evaluation set began being gathered. If you imported the version, this is the date that the evaluation set data in the source version began being gathered.

nested_items.name: EvaluationDataEndTime
nested_items.description: The date on which the data in the evaluation set began being gathered. If you imported the version, this is the date that the evaluation set data in the source version finished being gathered.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that was used to train the model version.

nested_items.name: DataPreProcessingConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration is the TargetSamplingRate, which is the sampling rate of the data after post processing by Amazon Lookout for Equipment. For example, if you provide data that has been collected at a 1 second level and you want the system to resample the data at a 1 minute rate before training, the TargetSamplingRate is 1 minute.

nested_items.name: TargetSamplingRate
nested_items.description: The sampling rate of the data after post processing by Amazon Lookout for Equipment. For example, if you provide data that has been collected at a 1 second level and you want the system to resample the data at a 1 minute rate before training, the TargetSamplingRate is 1 minute.

nested_items.name: TrainingExecutionStartTime
nested_items.description: The time when the training of the version began.

nested_items.name: TrainingExecutionEndTime
nested_items.description: The time when the training of the version completed.

nested_items.name: FailedReason
nested_items.description: The failure message if the training of the model version failed.

nested_items.name: ModelMetrics
nested_items.description: Shows an aggregated summary, in JSON format, of the model's performance within the evaluation time range. These metrics are created when evaluating the model.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: Indicates the last time the machine learning model version was updated.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: Indicates the time and date at which the machine learning model version was created.

nested_items.name: ServerSideKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the KMS key key used to encrypt model version data by Amazon Lookout for Equipment.

nested_items.name: OffCondition
nested_items.description: Indicates that the asset associated with this sensor has been shut off. As long as this condition is met, Lookout for Equipment will not use data from this asset for training, evaluation, or inference.

nested_items.name: SourceModelVersionArn
nested_items.description: If model version was imported, then this field is the arn of the source model version.

nested_items.name: ImportJobStartTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the import job began. This field appears if the model version was imported.

nested_items.name: ImportJobEndTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the import job completed. This field appears if the model version was imported.

nested_items.name: ImportedDataSizeInBytes
nested_items.description: The size in bytes of the imported data. This field appears if the model version was imported.

nested_items.name: PriorModelMetrics
nested_items.description: If the model version was retrained, this field shows a summary of the performance of the prior model on the new training range. You can use the information in this JSON-formatted object to compare the new model version and the prior model version.

nested_items.name: RetrainingAvailableDataInDays
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of days of data used in the most recent scheduled retraining run.

nested_items.name: AutoPromotionResult
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the model version was promoted to be the active version after retraining or if there was an error with or cancellation of the retraining.

nested_items.name: AutoPromotionResultReason
nested_items.description: Indicates the reason for the AutoPromotionResult. For example, a model might not be promoted if its performance was worse than the active version, if there was an error during training, or if the retraining scheduler was using MANUAL promote mode. The model will be promoted in MANAGED promote mode if the performance is better than the previous model.

nested_items.name: ModelDiagnosticsOutputConfiguration
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location where Amazon Lookout for Equipment saves the pointwise model diagnostics for the model version.

nested_items.name: S3OutputConfiguration
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location for the pointwise model diagnostics.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the pointwise model diagnostics are located. You must be the owner of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 prefix for the location of the pointwise model diagnostics. The prefix specifies the folder and evaluation result file name. ( bucket).

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) key identifier to encrypt the pointwise model diagnostics files.

nested_items.name: ModelDiagnosticsResultsObject
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 output prefix for where Lookout for Equipment saves the pointwise model diagnostics for the model version.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the specific S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS key) key being used to encrypt the S3 object. Without this key, data in the bucket is not accessible.

nested_items.name: ModelQuality
nested_items.description: Provides a quality assessment for a model that uses labels. If Lookout for Equipment determines that the model quality is poor based on training metrics, the value is POOR_QUALITY_DETECTED. Otherwise, the value is QUALITY_THRESHOLD_MET.
